{{cpp/title|is_error_code_enum}}
{{cpp/error/error_code/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=system_error|since=c++11|
template&lt; class T &gt;
struct is_error_code_enum;
}}

If {{tt|T}} is an error code enumeration (such as {{lc|std::io_errc}} and {{lc|std::future_errc}}), this template provides the member constant {{c|value}} equal {{c|true}}. For any other type, {{c|value}} is {{c|false}}.

This template may be specialized for a {{lsd|cpp/language/type#Program-defined type}} to indicate that the type is eligible for {{lc|std::error_code}} implicit conversion.

===Helper variable template===
{{ddcl|since=c++17|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
constexpr bool is_error_code_enum_v = is_error_code_enum&lt;T&gt;::value;
}}

{{cpp/types/integral_constant/inherit|{{tt|T}} is an error code enum}}

{{example
|code=
#include &lt;ios&gt;
#include &lt;system_error&gt;

static_assert(std::is_error_code_enum_v&lt;decltype(std::io_errc::stream)&gt;);
static_assert(!std::is_error_code_enum_v&lt;std::error_category&gt;);

int main() {}
}}
